positive.review:
I think my current playtime speaks volumes for how much I enjoy this little game, but I'll ramble on.

Ropuka's Idle Island is a very very simple and basic idle game that sits anywhere on your desktop. It's very easy to resize Ropuka and his island and relocate it so that it won't get in the way of anything, and you can toggle it so that it can or can't take priority over other windows (sit on top). He's just a little frog guy who has a little island to take care of, he won't disrupt you! You can also turn off the music and ambience separately, meaning that I can mute the music but still keep the sounds of wind and birds to a "low hum" for relaxation.

I've seen some people deem this game "boring", and I get that. This is no action game, there isn't much you can do with Ropuka other than customise him and his island. But it's important to remember this game is intended to give you a little desktop friend who does his own thing whilst you also do your own thing. I personally like big numbers and seeing them rise, so I like leaving him for a few hours and coming back to see millions of grass trimmings. Plus, this game is very low-demand so you can easily run a different game or other programs alongside it!

Overall, I love the little chill vibes this game brings. And I love little Ropuka, too.

Ropuka doesn't compile and sell my data. Ropuka doesn't try to sell me micro-transactions. Ropuka just trims grass for coins and naps. Occasionally Ropuka waves and offers words of encouragement. Good frog is good. Good game is good. Want nothing more.

Ropuka is one of my favorite idle games. It's extremely calming with a wonderful soundtrack and ambiance. While I enjoy plenty of games, this is a game that did exceed my expectations. The items are varied and so cute. I find it really centering to have going in the background while I'm doing other things, stressful or otherwise. Also, having the nice blurbs from Ropuka pop up occasionally is a good little nudge of encouragement. Genuinely more than worth the price.

runs perfectly even when playing resource heavy games, absolutely adorable with dozens of customization options to both Ropuka and his island

worth every cent
One of the better idle buddy games. As described, meant to be placed somewhere on the desktop while working or doing other things. Highly customizable
ropuka got me through a really rough patch this past year and gave me something to focus on and relax to at the same time during the worst of moments. big thanks to a little frog
Very cute if a bit bare-bones idle game. The stats are somewhat unclear and unlocks are quite slow. But it's nice to look at while doing other stuff, and for the price that's enough imo.
great game to have on the second monitor while doing virtually anything

Don't expect much to do in here.

The game is what you see, just a frog cutting grass and sleeping. You can change how everything looks, but that's it.

If you want to have a background game that plays some music and environment sounds this is for you, but if you plan to min/max it, you are in for a long time

Ropuka is a hard game to review outside of; it does what the box says. There's Ropuka, there's an island, and it's idle.

There's a lot of random min maxing that you can do, but if you want a little guy cutting away at grass, with the occasional lottery via a wait or (with game currency, not real world) buy system to get cosmetic options, then this game is pretty bang on. With the option for ambient sounds (wind, rain, etc.) and lo-fi genre of music, it's perfect for what it does; being a true idle game.

I just like having a little frog dude sit at the bottom of my monitor whenever I'm writing, and the ambient sounds and lo-fi is just an added bonus :)
He just hangs out on his island, while I play other games. He works, and he rests, in perfect balance. Its exactly what i think of when i try and describe my ideal desktop "buddy" idle buddy.
Great soundtrack, relaxing idle game.
Absolutely love watching this little frog go. With the soft music it's perfect for filling up the screen and taking a nap.

[b]Ropuka's Idle Island[/b] is a great idle game. Imagine a little frog that cuts the grass whilst you are working late, either with your job or writing an essay. Or even if you are alone on a Friday night.

You can adjust the size, if it's going to be on top of everything, ambient sounds and some nice background music.
Adorable interactive wallpaper/idle farmer. The game is definitely heavy on the idle aspect though. My entire play-time is what you'll have to expect if you want to unlock all the achievements.

A lovely, relaxing idle game.
Cute graphics, no pressure, just a cute frog cutting some grass.

not my type of game, but that's okay. the only funny thing for me about it is that the grass didn't render at all on my last computer, and because of this, the game was broken. I sent the files to the developer's mail and they replied within a day. it didn't solve the problem, but it was kinda nice anyway
Very nice casual game, I don't even know how I got addicted to it!

Good game. No Great game. You sit and watch mesure frog man cut his grass. 

Honestly the control and menu's are freaking awesome for this game and a genuine pleasant surprise. Then customization makes the look and feel top notch, allowing you to match a wide range of colored backgrounds or screens for your frog man to chill out in. The only thing I kinda wish was a thing would be for him to have a pond to sit at on his island. Even then thats just cause I like frogs. 

Amazing game, much love to the creator(s)

[h3]This will be a neutral review that is slightly positive.[/h3]

I gave this game a shot because of the extremely positive reviews. As it is not compatible on MAC (I know, but I am a designer and a frontend coder so MAC it is for now) I played it [u]on SteamDeck and it is fully compatible[/u]. So I don't have the experience on resizing and blending it. 

It is a slow idle game, so [u]don't expect high numbers or lots of achievements[/u], there will be NO dopamine hits with this one. I am at 8 hours right now and it is still really much the beginning of the game, I am at 0,81% of completion T-T

The art is beautiful though and what makes this review positive is the ambiant noises and music that makes the [u]overall experience extremely calming[/u].
So this one is a pure idle game, really slow, just sitting there, the frog sometimes waves or talks to me and runs around cutting grass but is mostly sleeping. I am a [i]little jealous of him to be honest.[/i]

It is not my kind of idle game but in its niche I could understand its appeal. There are not many games like that because it is a risky move to have a game without "gameplay".
Ropuka is living his best life on my desktop, and seeing him run around, take cozy looking naps, and occasionally waving hi at me is a delight. Love my lil buddy. <3
Nice art style and a fun little distraction on your desktop.

cozy and easy-going, it has lovely animation and helps to stay focus 
frog/10, would recommend
cute game to have in the background. Useful for when you're doing homework, studying etc and need a quick distraction before recollecting your thoughts.

This game is simple... in all the best ways! it starts off easy, and remains that way, you watch yer little frogman cut the lawn, and increase his stats, increase his living space looks, and increase YOUR enjoyment. Best couple bucks I ever spent, I leave him on at night while I sleep, and he just keeps cutting the grass!!
An amazing, relaxing idle game where you can have up in the corner while working, studying, etc. Beautiful graphics.

I absolutely love this idle game! It is cute and cozy, one can have it pinned above all windows or just hidden under while working, watching movies or playing another games. It doesn't tax your resources so there is no problem running it in the background while playing even AAA games. 
I only wish there would be something like infinite progression or a way to spend points even after hitting the cap on unlocks and upgrades... but all in all I LOVE my little froggo friend!

I enjoy his little company while I'm doing laundry or journaling. He encourages me to stay productive but take breaks often. If you just need a little buddy to keep you company, Ropuka does a great job of that <3

Great game to relax, lots of nice visual options, the music is tranquil and soothing and you can choose tracks to play. The gameplay is very simple yet still leaves you tasks to do whenever you feel like it, no rush, just allocate resources as you see fir or buy new cosmetics which are plenty. 
Very convenient window resize options and you can place it wherever you see fit which is great whenever you got some chores you got to do with time windows.
Yeah, also, Ropuka is a nice person who says something nice to you time to time.

What makre Ropuka different from other idle games I've played is that it does not distract me. If I have a game in the background, usually I am too much tempted to check back in: I can build, I can buy, I can endlessly progress - not with Ropuka. Ropuka does not need to expand his house or buy more tools - He spends his day content cutting grass.  I do not have to check on him, I know exactly what he's doing, and the only progress I get is by giving it time. And the aestethics make it enyojable to witness.
Absolute gold, love watching frog running around and cutting grass.

A frog, a lawnmower, and an island. That’s it—and it’s weirdly addictive. No grind, no stress, just pure idle satisfaction. Ropuka mows, you upgrade, the island grows. It’s more desktop buddy than game, but that’s the charm.
Pros: Relaxing, simple progression, oddly therapeutic.
Cons: Too chill for players chasing action.
Verdict: 9/10 blades of grass. Would let Ropuka mow again.

I love this game. I'm only missing 2 achievements now. It's just so fun to set it and forget it. It's nice to look over and see the little island that you decorated with your little guy that you also dressed up, cutting grass or napping. I love him and wish I could be him.

It's not hard. Just takes awhile. As I've gotten older I've learned to appreciate the down time I do have, and that it's ok for things to be slower. This game is the personification of that. As a frogman with bunny ears.
I love this game, it is so enjoyable to just watch the little guy running around and living life.
Really cute game that keeps you company while you're being productive. And you can earn coins and upgrade things or change appearance.
very chill game. so chill i also took a nap while its playing on the background
Cute Idle game, tho very slow paced wouldn't recommend to people who like to rush games
A cozy little companion that's perfect for long study or work nights. It gives you something to return to during short breaks and helps me concentrate in the long run.
Great little game in an age of oversaturation and overdevelopment. All the little touches make this one really special.
Fun, unique, and does not require constant attention like other "idle" games

This is an awesome idler. I think it's the first one i have ever had but i keep coming back to it :D
Every time i work on my own little projects like drawing or writing i open this up to help me focus. Also the in game music and weather sound choices are awesome!! Not to mention how many updates there has been since i bought the game. It feels like it was truly made with love!
very cute and relaxing companion, unfortunately i lost a ton of progess with an update some months ago

[h1]A nice cozy frog grass cutting game. (8/10) [/h1]

[h3]Pros: [/h3]
*Has many settings to get it to how you like it unlike many other desktop idlers.
*Tons of cosmetics for you to get by either gambling or direct purchase (Ingame currency)
*Actually has several diffrent languages for you to pick

[h3]Cons: [/h3]
*Ultimatly can get repetetive like most idle games
*Still gets occasional updates (to my knowledge) with new cosmetics for your island and more

A true relaxing idle game that doesn't impact PC performance at all. Can easily run on the side while working, playing other games, or just browsing the internet. You don't have to stress about potentially missing something like some other idle games. There are lots of customization options and upgrades to get. Highly recommend it if you're looking for a simple idle game that doesn't overwhelm you with too many options or timed events.
Ropuka is cutting the grass. I hope this game somehow works with the next.
Very chill, love the music in the background as I game.
this is the most idle of all idle games, you pretty much do nothing but upgrade and buy cosmetic stuff, but its still a cute goofy little game got it on sale
Literally the best Idle Game to ever exist, love this silly frog and watching him cut grass all day! <3
100% the Achievements and would do it again. My little Ropuka got my back 24/7. Love the customization options, I change my island for every season irl.
Such a cute little and fun game. It is simple, but it fulfill its purpose well.

Love to have little Ropuka with me to decorate my monitor during otherwise mundane work tasks. This little idle game is such a gem, and my cat loves it too (he watches Ropuka and the bunny from my lap). Customization options keep it fresh without becoming a distraction. Fantastic!
very cut and relaxing, my wife loves watching ropuka sleep
Its neat to see the little frog work while you yourself are working. Get it in a Deal and enjoy

Cozy and nice desktop companion.
I really like the ambience and it's soothing while working.

What a chill and funny game!

Unfortunately my Laptop is a little bit too weak, Cooling Fans run constantly on 100%
Good relaxing game to leave on the side whilst doing other stuff
Overly AFK game where you click sometimes. It's really nice
Loving this so far. Very chill to just watch the little guy cut grass and hang loose.
Very nice relaxing idler. Enjoy the music and rabbit running across the island. Fun to customise the island even if I don't have much unlocked yet.
sapinho simpatico cuidas de sua linda fazenda enquanto você preenche planilhas e questiona como chegamos até aqui, vamos retornar ao solo
I'm not an idle game person usually, but hey frog gardener. It's nice and chill, and the music's very earwormy.
One of the great examples that simple is better. It allows those relaxing moments in the middle of work
Отличная расслабляющая игрушка, с хорошей музыкой, делать особо ничего не надо, зато немного можно отвлечься и расслабиться.

It is pretty and pretty neat. Frog cuts grass. Frog takes nap. Frog cuts more grass. Eventually you'll decorate the island a little. Frog is happy.

This is the game. I like it.
very ideal to set aside when you want to focus. You can adjust the size as you like and also drag it to any location. It will never get in the way.

Ropuka's Idle Island is the epitome of idlers. You can leave it and just accumulate money, watching your frog just chill and cut grass, eventually get a pet or two to frolic in the grass on your little floating island. It does reward you for logging in once a day, so I find myself just running it for a little bit each day rather than running it nonstop.
I love this calm little game. Even as something in the background, it's just great when you're feeling sick or are doing other things.

This game is a lovely pop up window that has a lot of adjustable elements on how quiet and off your radar it can be. It also is a frog cutting grass and just relaxing on a small island property. If that interests you in any way this is a fantastic game and I recommend it to anyone who enjoys idle games or frogs.
I also took one of the free backgrounds as my desktop wallpaper to really set the mood, which I think is a mark of quality all in itself!
I don't write reviews much, but this game is a little gem in the sea of monsters populating this platform. You should try it.
He's just my lil frog buddy who lives on my desktop and cuts grass and sleeps

Cute, stylish and fun. 
I love that I don't have to stress and can just let it run hours on end with no issues. Can't wait to grind out the rest of the achievements.
This is a fantastic game! A very relaxing time spending game. Absolutely a must have!

Cute lil' idle game you can keep up anywhere while doing anything. upgrade-itis itch is definitely scratched with speed, durability, and grass upgrades. decor items abound. Soothing rain sounds as a frog cuts grass and naps
Playing for 100+ hrs. Nice chilling friend on desktop while working, I do recommmend this game but it'd be great if they could add some more music.
Cute little froggie just chills and clips the grass. No yelling "get off my grass!" Bonus cuteness: bunnies!
Just press play and relax, simple and neat. Great visuals and cute cosmetics it's the best idle zen game out there!
Very relaxing and cool + lil frog guy is adorableeee :3

Amazing and relaxing game. I can just sit back an relax while listening to some music, podcast or audiobooks, or while working on whatever.

The different art and things to dress up your little frog an island. A 10 out of 10, because the art and music of it is just right
Such a pleasant idle game that it's also easy to relax and just feel the calm vibes. The visual style is also very likeable!
This game a great game if you want something to have in the background while doing things like studying, working, or just relaxing. 10/10 would cut more grass again.

Ropuka's Idle Island is awesome! It's my perfect companion while I'm working. I bought the two bunnies and just watch my froggy cut grass. So chill and zen. 

I highly recommend it if you want the feeling of playing a game without actually needing to play or focus on it.  :D

Nice little desktop distraction. I'd want the pace to be a liiitle bit faster, but that's not critical.
Also, worth to note - if you are using screen capturing software while playing the game - you might have some issues. Negligible, but worth to notice:
1. Software that creates a name for a recording of your screen based on the active app you are recording will always call it Ropuka's Idle Island, since the game is always the top layer.
2. Similar if your application detects the window you want to capture. It will not detect any windows because on top of them all is an invisible game that captures all the mouse inputs.
So just be aware.
Super chill little idle game. i like having it open in the corner and seeing him chop the grass.
Lovely to have open while doing tasks and such so it can do it's thing. Very chill and fun to watch after some upgrades.

There are so many pathetic sayings like "less is more." But this one is the one that comes to mind when I play Ropuka. It's so calm and soothing. Nothing is required of the player, there are no goals, no need to keep up, nothing to fear—the unattainable dream of an adult in a modern world full of obligations.
this is the chillest game ever to watch :> and the music is immaculate

This is my type of idle clicker. It's purely ran of vibes, and is not meant to be a game you try to beat as soon as possible. It is much more of an animated widget for your second monitor that has immaculate vibes. The music incredible, the grass cutting pristine, and the aesthetics unmatched
very subtle and non invasive desktop game. it can be resized to as small or as large as desired and put anywhere on the screen. you forget he's even there. i love to give him hats.

A chill game about a frog cutting grass, you don't have to actively partake in the game and can resize the little guy and his island to fit anywhere on your desktop. You can just sit back, do your work, as he continues cutting grass.

Great game and fulfills an idle game wish I've always had. I love that the window can be resized easily and placed around your monitor so you can always keep it active while doing other work. Good progression ramp, love the art style and ambience. Really happy with this game, if you even slightly interested in the concept, I highly recommend buying this
frogging and cutting. dont need much else. except maybe christmas lights. that would indeed give me christmas spirit and light up the dark.
I find myself always opening this game when on my pc doing any sort of task. It's great to fiddle with the customization.

I have a particular weakness to idle games... to my brain they're not actually idle but take up a bunch of mental space and constantly urges me to complete it. I really loathe this game. It's a good idle game, but I hate it.

im always hoping for something that does its own thing and you then can interact with when u feel like it. kinda like a cat or dog. like they just chill and exist in the same room as you but then if you feel like playing with them you can or pet them or whatever. and these desktop pets... i always assume thats what that experience basically is but without a actual animal making ur house dirty. but are but they never are. they are in my opinion never interactive enough.  HOWEVER i will give it a thumbs up due to this one being more interactive than others that ive tried. so if you are as person who actually is into this kinda stuff, id say this one might be perfect for you. but for me it was still kinda a let down.
Low effort idle game/desktop companion. Cool frog even waves at you!
i'm glad ropuka keeps cheering me on. a lot of nice, calm music. weather change. many maps and items to equip. getting coins is not that easy. it takes time.

Well my little frog buddy is more productive than I am. Great little fun game! :D
weather sound change could be more gradually tho.

It's super nice! Unlike other idle games where you have to pay attention once in a while to collect your resources, you can just leave Ropuka there. You can also select sounds of rain or wind which helps me a lot with focusing.

Nice game! very cozy and relaxing overlay on your desktop while you do other stuff on the computer
9.5/10
Excellent idle game!  I put this on last night before bed, and just watched the little guy cut grass until I passed out.  Worked like a charm!

negative.review: I was genuinely having a great time with this game. I finally started to see insane yield and was unlocking a lot of outfits. I closed the game out and upon reopening it, my save file had been reverted like 100+ hours. Pages I had were no longer filled, none of the outfits I had were there, I lost a bunny I bought, and all my stats went from triple digits to single and double digits. I tried fixing it by renaming the bak file and nothing happened. Actually sucks man. It's a good game, but its whole purpose is to be a bit of a time sync and when that can just be reset...well whats the point?
It SO idle it's more like a screensaver or animated background, if even. You can click some meh things for meh results and nothing really changes.

Sleep, cut grass, sleep and cut more grass.  That is all this is, nothing more.  Not sure why people like this, it does two things and that is it.   The little dude said hi when I first started the game, a day later and I have yet to hear him say anything else.  Very very BORING, even for an idle game.

God bless

Overall a good game but there are two things I think it lacks:

1. A less basic upgrade system. The upgrades you can unlock at the start are ~70% of the upgrades you'll be using through the entire game. And the other ~30% are from items which upgrade the same stats that you were already upgrading at the beginning. In total there are only 6 stats that you can change through upgrades.

2. More clear descriptions of what stuff does. Explain what changing "sleep mode" does when you hover over it. Be clear what the difference between "pages filled" and "pages maxed" is.

If the second issue was fixed I'd change my review to positive
Uma bosta

I don't really know what people see in this idle game, I get that the idea is to be idle but this one feels *very* very idle. The only input you have is buying upgrades and opening loot boxes for cosmetics, Ropuka does everything else on his own. And what he does is cut a few pieces of grass, nap for 30 seconds, cut a few more pieces of grass, nap for a while longer, repeat for however long you keep the game open. The music is fine but inconvenient if you're trying to do anything else, and the nature sounds are not very good either.

This might be alright if you work from home and just want something to occupy some space on your screen, but I feel like there are much better desktop buddy games that you could get some engagement from.

I'm so glad I'm done with this game, this is my first negative review on my account and I feel bad :( 
I can't really tell you if it's worth it for the price because this is the most idle idle game I've played so far, you legit don't do anything really other than watch the frog cut the grass and it took me this many hours to get all achievements which is insane, the last achievement is just wild. 
However, its only 4 euro and it IS a cute game just not much interaction comparing to other idle games out there. 
You just watch him cut grass wait until you get coins and play the lottery at the end of the day of you playing and you can upgrade basically how fast he can cut the grass which can make you get coins faster but thats it.. and you can decorate the island but it doesnt have too many options imo! 
Play Rusty's if you're looking for an amazing idle game <3
Think it depends what you're looking for I think with idle games. 
and sorry for the bad review :(

I closed the game out and upon reopening it, my save file had been reverted like 100+ hours. Pages I had were no longer filled, none of the outfits I had were there, I lost a bunny I bought, and all my stats went from triple digits to single and double digits. I tried fixing it by renaming the bak file and nothing happened. Actually sucks man. The little dude said hi when I first started the game, a day later and I have yet to hear him say anything else.  Very very BORING, even for an idle game.

God bless

I enjoy Rusty's Retirement. There's a puzzle aspect to laying things out, like an efficiency puzzle.

What you see is what you get from the very first screen in this game. He will wander around, cut grass, and take a rest. Repeated indefinitely. The only input you have is to increase his speed at doing those things. I suppose that if all you're looking for is a cozy screen saver, then this might be your thing, but I contend that you'll be sick of watching the frog after 5 minutes.

Overall a good game but there are two things I think it lacks:

1. A less basic upgrade system. The upgrades you can unlock at the start are ~70% of the upgrades you'll be using through the entire game. And the other ~30% are from items which upgrade the same stats that you were already upgrading at the beginning. In total there are only 6 stats that you can change through upgrades.

2. More clear descriptions of what stuff does. Explain what changing "sleep mode" does when you hover over it. Be clear what the difference between "pages filled" and "pages maxed" is.

If the second issue was fixed I'd change my review to positive
Uma bosta

The only input you have is buying upgrades and opening loot boxes for cosmetics, Ropuka does everything else on his own. And what he does is cut a few pieces of grass, nap for 30 seconds, cut a few more pieces of grass, nap for a while longer, repeat for however long you keep the game open. The music is fine but inconvenient if you're trying to do anything else, and the nature sounds are not very good either.

This might be alright if you work from home and just want something to occupy some space on your screen, but I feel like there are much better desktop buddy games that you could get some engagement from.

I'm so glad I'm done with this game, this is my first negative review on my account and I feel bad :( 
I can't really tell you if it's worth it for the price because this is the most idle idle game I've played so far, you legit don't do anything really other than watch the frog cut the grass and it took me this many hours to get all achievements which is insane, the last achievement is just wild. 
However, its only 4 euro and it IS a cute game just not much interaction comparing to other idle games out there. 
You just watch him cut grass wait until you get coins and play the lottery at the end of the day of you playing and you can upgrade basically how fast he can cut the grass which can make you get coins faster but thats it.. and you can decorate the island but it doesnt have too many options imo! 
Play Rusty's if you're looking for an amazing idle game <3
Think it depends what you're looking for I think with idle games. 
and sorry for the bad review :(

I was genuinely having a great time with this game. I finally started to see insane yield and was unlocking a lot of outfits. I closed the game out and upon reopening it, my save file had been reverted like 100+ hours. Pages I had were no longer filled, none of the outfits I had were there, I lost a bunny I bought, and all my stats went from triple digits to single and double digits. I tried fixing it by renaming the bak file and nothing happened. Actually sucks man. It's a good game, but its whole purpose is to be a bit of a time sync and when that can just be reset...well whats the point?
It SO idle it's more like a screensaver or animated background, if even. You can click some meh things for meh results and nothing really changes.

Sleep, cut grass, sleep and cut more grass.  That is all this is, nothing more.  Not sure why people like this, it does two things and that is it.   The little dude said hi when I first started the game, a day later and I have yet to hear him say anything else.  Very very BORING, even for an idle game.

God bless

I enjoy Rusty's Retirement. There's a puzzle aspect to laying things out, like an efficiency puzzle.

What you see is what you get from the very first screen in this game. He will wander around, cut grass, and take a rest. Repeated indefinitely. The only input you have is to increase his speed at doing those things. I suppose that if all you're looking for is a cozy screen saver, then this might be your thing, but I contend that you'll be sick of watching the frog after 5 minutes.

Overall a good game but there are two things I think it lacks:

1. A less basic upgrade system. The upgrades you can unlock at the start are ~70% of the upgrades you'll be using through the entire game. And the other ~30% are from items which upgrade the same stats that you were already upgrading at the beginning. In total there are only 6 stats that you can change through upgrades.

2. More clear descriptions of what stuff does. Explain what changing "sleep mode" does when you hover over it. Be clear what the difference between "pages filled" and "pages maxed" is.

If the second issue was fixed I'd change my review to positive
